review: ik.imagekit.io
ik.imagekit.io
ik.imagekit.io
ik.imagekit.io
Breakfast kurang variatif. Cek in jam 15.30 sore katanya kamarnya full. Pelayan receptionist kurang ramah.
ik.imagekit.io
Cocok untuk keluarga dan bawa anak. Cuma ga gitu banyak fasilitas.
Hotel sangat baik, bersih, staf ramah dan sangat membantu.
Kamar luas, staf hotel betul-betul sangat membantu dan ramah.

Kamar hotel beserta kamar mandinya,sangat sangat luas.Pemandangan luar kamar juga indah. Staff ramah.Kebetulan anak saya berulang tahun dan kami mendapatkan cake birthday yang rasanya enak.Hanya sayang, lokasi jauh dari universal studio dan harus menggunakan free shutte bus dari resort world sentosa.Tapi overall,menyenangkan menginap di hotel ini

While the room and bathroom are big (with super king bed), the services are rather standard and below what we expect. From the front desk to the restaurant where the breakfast is, we don't feel the hospitality standard expected for this kind of 5 star hotel. The breakfast is also below standard, with only local, western, and vegetarian sets. Seems like just to tick the box. Below average again. Certainly not worth the money.
Check in was smooth. Room and pool were great. What is inconvenient is the long walking to the rooms just because of the ID check that needs to be performed. Easily 100 m extra per trip.

I was rather frustrated by the long wait for check in. The kiosks provided were hard to use. However, everything was lovely after that. Responsive and friendly staff. My children enjoyed the staycation very much and we are definitely going back soon.

Had a fantastic stay with my family, and would definitely consider coming back again. Check-in was relatively simple, even at the self-check in machine, with the help of the staff, and the rooms are spacious and bright. Had indicated previously our preference for a high level, forest-facing room which the hotel easily accommodated, and we had a fantastic view of the cable cars amidst the rainforest. And the toilet is an experience in itself, with a great big bathtub and rain shower. Swimming pool had to be booked but was lovely and unique with resort feels as well. There's also a free shuttle bus which which brings you to the main RWS area and back, and is available till nighttime. Check out was even faster and just required returning the key cards. Do remember to approach the counter staff to get the complimentary parking coupon though. Cheers to all the staff who are always helpful, and who made our staycay even with older parents easy and pleasant.

A good choice for quiet retreat, not crowded. The staff are friendly and helpful to give advice to various attractions on the island. The downside is the lack of facilities such as spa and limit choice of restaurants (a bit expensive though). There is free transfer every 10 mins to RWS.

It was cumbersome to scan safe entry at the poolside since we have already booked the slot. It doesn't make sense to us as we have already registered ourselves with the hotel. We didn't feel safe to bring our phone to the poolside and leave it unattended.

It was a good experience as our requests were all met. RWS staffs are attentive and delivered their service as promised. It 's a pity that it rained for both days and did not get to enjoy the pool. But is all good with the excellent service, will definitely return again. The festive package was such a deal that includes table65 Michelin star award winning restaurant.

1. Self-service check-in is not at all user-friendly, even their staff started arguing among themselves while trying to assist.  2. Booking of check-in time and pool prior to checking in to the hotel could be easily missed/ overlooked. By the time when I heard from a friend who has recently stayed at the same hotel, that I need to pre-book the use of the pool before checking-in, the only available timeslot was at 11am the following day and check out time was 11am. Most hotels are granting late check out at 3 pm onward for staycation.  3. We were so looking forward to the hotel breakfast and we got the worst shock of our life when we saw the breakfast menu. If the hotel cannot serve a buffet breakfast, they should at least serve a decent a la carte buffet breakfast. The Chinese set breakfast was a disgrace. Bland white porridge with a few pcs of cuttlefish, 2 pcs of shrimps, and crabsticks for hotel standard seafood porridge. We had staycation experience in other hotels and so far, this is our worst experience. Glad that we only stayed one night. For more than $600 per room per night for this kind of experience really sucks!
The room is spacious and clean.

Love the room. Its super spacious and the toilet is awesomely huge as well. The view is super awesome. But check in procedures were too long. I reached at 1plus and room was only ready at 5.30pm! Didn't have a coffee machine so quite dissappointing for a 5 star hotel.
Staffs were helpful and polite. Only that unable to get connecting rooms.

1) We arranged for early check in and bed arrangement months before check in. Upon arrival at the hotel, however, we were informed that the rooms were not ready and we had to inform the staff again on our bed arrangement. We also requested for rooms on high floor but in the end, I believe we were given rooms on low floor as those were the only ones that were available after at least a 30 minutes at the check in process. 2) Our request for special arrangement for my dad's birthday was not delivered to the front desk as well. In the end, we only got a card and a few Ferraro Rochers (which seems like a last minute work) when we were expecting more from a 5-star hotel. 3) We also made prior pool reservation but when we checked with the staff working at the pool, our reservation was not recorded. 4) Towels and water were not provided for the third person staying in the room after housekeeping on the second day. All these made our stay at the hotel unpleasant. We were hoping for more from a 5-star hotel.
The room is very big, spacious and comfy, we enjoyed the stay there regardless the delayed check in time. We will not hesitate to stay at Equarius Hotel again for our next staycation. Cheers!

Equarius has a spacious room. We felt so cosy staying in it. The balcony overlooking nature and the trees was love at first sight. We went during the halloween period and we can see a lot of places with halloween themed decorations. Service staff was great and served with a smile and light hearted jokes. Definitely would return to visit, so far the best hotel we've been in, in Sentosa

The room looks so spacious, comfortable and grand. It makes one want to stay in the room all day. Perfect for families or a couple getaway! PSA: Bring Bubble Bath! Shuttle service are available every 15 minutes to bring you to hotel Michael! Or you can take a stroll along the outdoor path which is about close to 10 minutes too.

Check I/O could have been a better process. We were coming from the carpark so when we entered the lobby there was no specific instructions or a line to show us the way for check in. People seen sitting on the sofas some were lining up at the front desk. The machine to check in wasn't able to detect booking either So the staff had to eventually help me out manually. But can I say that the staff were extremely patient and so kind despite the busy peak hours. Very polite and whenever we called for assistance from the room, the service came within 5 minutes. The room was so big as well! Amazing view facing Harbourfront! Breakfast isn't buffet style but there ' s a menu for you to choose the mains. Keep in mind that the restaurant is not in Equarius OK! You gotta take the cute buggy at the entrance and they'll bring you to the other hotel. Love the ride, I think its super worth it. Highly highly recommend! Especially for family, would definitely come again. A huge shout out to the staff for making the stay fabulous 👍🏽.

The staff there are very helpful regardless check in or check out! We check out going to sea aquarium first and they helped to send the luggage to hotel Michael so we don't have to come back here to collect. They also drew a birthday card for my dad as it was his birthday and also my sis came after her wedding and they drew her a very cute card with blessing with chocolate. The rooms are very comfy and the tub is very big! Enjoyed our stay very much.
Very comfortable and customer service was great. Will definitely come and stay again!

All the staff were amazing and patient, rooms were super huge! Fantastic service. The only downside was during check-in, their check-in machines could not detect our booking as it was from the agent app, hence the wait was slightly longer. But again the staff made up for it, hence wonderful stay!

Check in was terrible. Self check in fail, have to take queue to check in counter. And only 1 check in counter. The SDA serving the self checking also blur. Only the hotel staff Kevin is helpful. As for room, dusty, even behind the TV also full of dust. If you have stay in Shangri-La Sentosa, you will definitely disappointed with equarius hotel.

The hotel doesn't have breakfast facility which is a bit of a challenge. We were on a one plus one deal and the first day our rooms we got were not interconnected, upon request we did get the interconnected rooms on our second night, which was more cleaner and hygienic then the first one.

Took 1hr 45mins for checking into my room. There are 4 self check in kiosks. However, these machines don't work well and there isn't any hotel staff standing nearby to provide support. Went to join the Q for check in. However, still have to wait 30 mins. Finally managed to get one hotel staff to assist me on self kiosk check in. However, room still not ready. I have to wait around 45 mins to check into the room.
Rooms are big, bathtub and peaceful environment, balcony is a plus.

The check in process is really bad. Staff service wasn't very helpful and little information is shared with you (like pool booking) when checking in. Opted for early check in when making the booking and wasn't contacted by the hotel that it was not available. Ended up waiting for 2 hours at Starbucks to wait for the room to be ready. Please call them to confirm if your early check in is confirmed.
Room was only ready at 5pm so we didn't manage to make full use of the room (and the check out was at 11am).
This hotel is awesome for family getaway. Free transport (buggy) available from hotel to main attraction point.
Power hotel service, did not process late check out request. Bathroom sink choked, water flow low.

Aside from the check in experience, the hotel experience overall was worth it. Pool is big, although there is no kids pool. The room itself os also big with the bathtub being able to fit two adults. Room space can comfortably fit two baby cots. As for the check in, need to press on them. Came in 2.30pm, checked in to hotel room only at close to 4.30pm.
Super nice clean spacious rooms, staff all very friendly. Enjoyed our stay.

My 3D2N staycation was truly awesome and fuss-free. We were offered a high level twin bed room with adventure cove/cable car view. The service team was very welcoming and attentive from the get-go. There is a free buggy shuttle to bring you to and for from Hotel Michael Lobby. The booking of facilities was smooth and done in a minute. I highly recommend Equarius hotel for couples, families with kids & friends. Hope to come back for another round of staycation with connecting rooms.

The stay was awesome although everytime we leave our room, we had to show our photo id. There is free buggy service to casino area. Check in was relatively fast for weekdays but had to wait awhile to go into our room.
Had to wait till 6 pm to check in to the hotel, no seats avaliable at reception and was standing waiting for 3 hours together with my pregnant wife and 2 year old baby.

Overall satisfactory stay on a weekday. Booked a deluxe room and the room was really spacious and quite clean. Bed was quite comfortable. Needed to book a slot for the swimming pool with not much hassle. Downside is that check in was abit late, could only check in close to 3.45pm although we have arrived at our timeslot of 2pm to 3pm. Hence had to skip some of our plans. Also to our disappointment, not much restaurants were open at RWS on a weekday (this was before phase 2HA when dining in was still possible). Breakfast at Hotel Michael was acceptable.

Room was super spacious, so was the bathroom! Swimming pool was real nice as well. Reception check in was a bit bumpy because the guy didn't register my requests which I sent in months back. Otherwise, great stay? Recommend.
Had stayed at Equarius Hotel on numerous occasions. The large room, the large bathroom with the big bathtub. The quiet surroundings is always a plus for a relaxing staycation.
Spacious room that comes with a bathtub, balcony, high quality amenity kits and TWG branded tea in room. Free parking, free buggy ride around RWS, pool and gym. Worth it.
A wonderful stay that's different from the usual staycation. Gives you a Bali vibe
The service/replies from the customer service officer at check in could be improved. Moreover, they are unable to prepare any form of celebration for birthday.
Love the pool! Can do laps in it!

Check in at 3pm and check out time at 11am means total 20 hours of stay for the price may not be worth it. Hotel has heightened security. All occupant and guests have to be registered in order to pass through the security by showing ID to go to room/lift everytime on top of safe entry. Quite dampening of the whole experience actually. Room is huge for lead in category. Pool at Beach Villa has tranquility but need to book in advance.
Service is superb. Staff all very friendly and helpful. Room is very clean. Spacious.

Everything except the checking in process was great! Nice clean room & very friendly staff. Though need to travel a bit to the main RWS area to have meals or attractions, shuttle or buggy service was only a short wait (within 10 min). However the check in process was very long, wasted 2 hours just waiting to register as there were only 2 counters for normal check in and 2 counters for VIP. It was very tiring wait especially with sleepy young children.

We were supposed to check out at noon with prior approval from front desk. However we were locked out of the room at 11.15am after we returned from swimming. Drenched in wet swim wear and I waited outside the room when my husband went down to front desk to seek help. It took them 15 minutes at the reception and finally someone accompanied my husband and opened the door. Left with 30 minutes to noon, we had to rush through a quick shower and packing. The staycation surely wasn't a pleasant experience. No one told us that we need to validate the room key when we requested for late check out.

There was around 30-45min wait during check-in and room were not ready yet at 3pm. Waited for another 30min to get the room key. Awesome room, big and spacious which accommodates 5 of us. They forgot to setup the roll-away bed but a call to concierge before dinner and it was done when we got back. Pool is also great but only limited to 1 spot of 45min only per day. The only disappointing thing is that we couldn't book pool slot for the next day until you have utilized the slots and by the time we call concierge to book no more slots were available. Overall good experience with staffs at Equarius.

Great place for staycation. Room and bathroom are large and clean. Friendly staff and excellent service. Hotel prepared lovely birthday decoration. As we came to celebrate my birthday. Appreciate it 🙏🏻 We had a good time, especially my daughters. They loved the swimming poll. Definitely will book again for our next staycation. Recommended 👍

We booked the hotel for our honeymoon and love it so much! It's so big and spacious! The toilet is awesome! The staff set up our bed and even personally sign the card to wish us on our marriage. We'll be back soon!

The bad: Arrived at the lobby at 2pm. Waited almost an hour to check in. Waited another 30min to get the key to 1 of our connecting rooms at 3.30pm. Waited for another 1.5hr and after 3 phone calls to collect the key for the other connecting room at 5pm! Tried booking swimming pool timing for 2nd day but the link doesn't help at all. Emailed in and finally managed to get a booking. Check out time indicated on booking is 12pm. However at check in, we were told check out time is at 11am. And they extended till 12pm upon request. On last day when I called the guest services to ask about how to check out. I was told again that my check out time is at 11am. I understand the hotel is shorthanded and needs longer time to do a good disinfection job. However, a 1.5 hour gap between getting the 2 connecting rooms ready doesn't make sense. The Good: Hotel rooms are huge. Bathrooms are huge. Beds are huge. Hotel staff arranged for some simple deco and gifted us some ice cream to celebrate my girl's birthday. Hotel staff are helpful. Swimming pool is simple but pleasant because of the crowd control. Overall a good stay if not for the long wait at check in. It's also inconvenient to travel to other parts of the island unless you drive. Otherwise you will have to take the free shuttle service, walk 5min to sentosa express.

Booked Check-in slot at 2-2.59pm, the whole check-in process took less than 15mins. I was served by Gregory, he was full of smiles and I was very pleased to be allocated a room on the 7th floor facing the watercove park. The view was spectacular, I could see the cable cars from the balcony and hear birds chirping away in the morning. Taking the shuttle bus to the Casino area was hassle-free. The swimming pool is a short walk away at the beach villa. Booking in advance is required for swimming session, since they limit the no. Of pax at the pool, it was not crowded at all. I like this hotel as it is tugged away from the crowded area at the Casino. I had a pleasant stay and will definitely choose this hotel for my next staycation at Sentosa 👍
1. Check-in took a long time. 2. We have set our room as "Do not disturb" and went out for dinner. However we can still see the hotel staff delivered drinks and towels into our room.

Overall experience was good but it would be truly awesome if we didn’t take that long to check-in. We waited for an hour from queue in the lobby to no queue. Finally someone approached us again after our countless checks with the reception whether our rooms are ready. It seems we have asked for adjoining rooms during our booking and it May not have gotten registered though their was an acknowledgment given. Housekeeping was still cleaning up the rooms. We were than put in a holding room while waiting for the rooms after another 20 mins check between reception and housekeeping. Nonetheless we appreciated the efforts. When we finally got to the rooms, one of the rooms smelled funny and I hope it was not becos we had rushed them for the housekeeping and they didn’t manage to do a thorough job. However this is our second visit to the hotel because we have like it from our first visit. Hope they can look into these improvement to make the experience truly awesome.

1. Check-in took really long. Was scheduled to check-in from 2 to 3 pm. Got there at 2.10 pm, and was asked to queue (there were only 2 pax before us) but we waited more than 15 min. Tried self check-in but doesn't work. The funny thing is, the day we checked out, I saw people checking in at 12ish. I wonder why were they given such early check-in but my request was declined. Probably need to upgrade their self check-in system as well. 2. Swimming pool "security " has different standards. They really need to have some standards here. Besides these two hiccups, the stay was generally good and relaxing.

Room was really huge. Pool was not fantastic, maybe because of all the fallen leaves and algae-plagued sun loungers. Hotel was clearly understaffed, we had to queue and wait quite a while before the only two staff in the whole reception area could attend to us, probably because the self-check-in machine could not detect lots of bookings. Understand that it’s covid season so checking in and out is crucial, however when we had to go swimming, we did not bring anything with us and we’re stranded with staff insisting that we need the physical ID or soft copy on our phones. We had checked in earlier and staff at the entrance had laptops with all our names and details, unsure why they couldn’t check their and than. Unpleasant experience for that. I would say the staff are courteous but hotel management was not good.
Best Staycation ever. All the staff are so friendly. We were here to celebrate our honeymoon and got a complimentary ben and jerry ice cream as a treat!
Spacious room. Great view. Friendly staff. Easy check-in. Big pool.
Room is spacious. Good for family getaway.

The room was spacious and beautiful. My partner and I truly enjoyed our little getaway. Special mentions to Jaysen (apologies if I got his name wrong) who checked us in. It’s really convenient despite it being quite a distance away from the attractions, due to the frequent shuttle buses and the buggy service. Only downside was that there isn’t a bidet in the otherwise amazing room ☹️

Though check-in can be a little slow now due to covid but I understand that it is for safety purposes 👍🏼 Service was nevertheless great, room was very neat and clean upon check-in. I loved how they have a sticker to indicate that the room had been disinfected and cleaned for us to check-in on our first day. The hotel really made me feel safe with all the safety protocols imposed.
Staff were very welcoming and friendly and made our staycation enjoyable throughout. Room is clean and spacious.

Quite a bad experience with this hotel, 1) Have sent request to this hotel for early check in at 2pm but they were late and informed that this early check in means I can come to hotel at 2pm to wait. 2) I have booked the hotel stay and basis app, it was mentioned that the check out time is 12pm but this hotel informed that the supposed check out time is 11am but they are giving us a favour to check out at 12pm. Overall quite a bad experience with this hotel and will not stay here anymore.
The room is very spacious and the bathtub is huge. We manage to get a slightly later check out since it’s quite quiet.
unorganized check-in process, be prepared to wait up to an hour. pool was pretty nice, but loads of mosquitos. be prepared to bring insecticide spray.
Spacious room! The kids loved it. Friendly and helpful staff! Convenient buggy rides to RWS. Booking of swimming pool slots was a breeze. Thank you for the pleasant stay!

The rooms were really good, but due to covid there were a lot of restrictions. We came as an extended family of 8 but could not go to each other’s rooms unless we were registered in each room which was way too troublesome. And breakfast was at Hotel Michael which required a buggy ride over. Sigh, it took us more than a year to finally be able to arrange this staycation together, but it was such a frustrating experience. Can’t blame the hotel, but damn Covid!

Had my 4D3N honeymoon with my hubby at Equarius Hotel and we enjoyed our peaceful, quality time here despite the covid situation. Really love the spacious and clean deluxe room, and their bathroom is amazingly huge and pretty with a bathtub! The only downside is that the pre-packed breakfast served every morning due to the "no dining in" rule was really disappointing. The quality of the food was really bad, with the bacon always being overly salty, and the scrambled eggs being overcooked and mushy, the baked pastries tasted stale as well. Hope that the hotel will be able to do something about the breakfast since the prices include free hotel breakfast (which was supposed to be of quality standard before the "no dine in" rule. Otherwise, can opt for no breakfast during this period of time and just go for the rooms!

My stay at Equarius hotel was memorable! Check in was smooth and easy and buggy service to and fro Sentosa RWS was convenient. The room is big with a sofa and round table for dining inside. Overall it is a relaxing and comfortable stay at Equarius hotel and thanks to the service staff that made it possible!
Room was very clean and spacious, better than expected. The staff were rly nice as well
Big room. Normal deco. No in-house services. Have to travel for food, entertainment etc. Nothing interesting in hotel. Have to walk a long distance from lobby to lift to rooms.

I really enjoyed the room, the bathroom has a huge bathtub which can fit two people comfortably. However, there are no bath salts provided, you will have to get your own. The amenities provided are 2-in-1 hand & body wash and 2-in-1 conditioning shampoo. The balcony has a great view of the cable car, beautiful especially in the evening. I spent a lot of time sitting outside to relax with some drinks. There is no room services options at all, you have to get your own food, or order via food delivery. The nearest food options are at Hotel Michael, which is a 5 minutes shuttle bus away. I gave this hotel overall unsatisfactory as the check in was not smooth and coordinated from the start. Upon booking, my requests for early check-in at 12pm was acknowledged by the hotel. I understand that it is still subject to availability but on the day itself, even when I arrived at 2:30pm, I can only check in at 3:30pm. I was given a queue number to wait for check-in. After 15-20 minutes, I was attended by Eugene which brought me to a self check-in station. I faced some issues with registration as they could not find my Booking ID, but when I eventually finished registration, I was told to wait to receive a SMS when my room is ready. The weather was really hot, I was thirsty and I just wanted to check in already. After 30-40 minutes, my room key is finally ready for collection. I asked for directions on where to collect, and was told to go to the concierge. When I went to the concierge, the staff told me to go the check-in area. (?) I had to walk around with my heavy bag for another 10 minutes because the staffs were directing me everywhere. When I finally check in, my partner which was sharing the room with me, said that I had to go down and pick him. Yet earlier, the hotel staff Eugene had informed that once I registered a room guest, I do not have to go down and pick them. They can self-check in upon arrival and be given a room key. After finally being able to check-in, I went down to pick up my partner. All these poor communication led to a very unsatisfactory check-in experience. I understand that we have to be extra vigilant during this covid period, however I did not face such frustration at other 5 stars hotels. I hope they can improve on their staff communication and check-in procedure. Besides that, I would still recommend this hotel as a great getaway due to its location.

Thank you to the team @ Equarius hotel for the great hospitality. From the moment we checked in, service was impeccable. It was little #JEO ‘s 4th birthday celebration and he had requested for a “hotel stay” (kids these days!) and so when Ms Jesslyn at the front desk knew about this, she gifted us with gifts for the little ones. #JEO was over the moon to have not 1 but 4 ice cream cups to start off his holiday! The staff were so attentive and we must applaud Ariel who was always greeting us with a smile - in spite of the mask, we knew he was always smiling from the spring in his step and the chirpiness of his voice. We met so many lovely guests too at the hotel - one of the families even gifted #JEO with his first cable car figurine as a birthday gift! We were really amazed at the sheer size of the room - 51 sq m was a great amount of space for 2 young kiddos to play and roam around! The size of the bathroom was perfect too! The only gripe we may have would be a suggestion for the hotel to include / provide bath amenities for young children / infants? You guys had a baby bath tub and a cot but didn’t have any bathing amenities for kids! This was a first I’ve encountered for a local staycation - even business hotels we’ve stayed in had amenities for children. Nonetheless, it was otherwise a very very lovely stay for us, glad we had a good time before CB- lite commences. Thank you Ms Jesslyn and your team for being ever attentive to us. Even the operator was always so delightful to talk to. From front desk to housekeeping, we had so many different encounters with the lovely hospitality team. So kudos to the management for incorporating a culture that percolates genuine happiness from the bottom up so we would enjoy our stay as guests.

Good service provided by the front desk and housekeeping staff. They are very polite and consistently reminded us on safety measures to abide to during the stay in their hotel. Hotel room is spacious and clean. Will definitely recommend by friends and relatives.
So far one of the best hotel i've stayed in. Would love to have another stay if I have the chance.
Great experience with Equarius! The room is very spacious with good views 😊 The frequent shuttle bus service makes it very convenient to travel between the forum and the hotel.

The hotel is of high standard in terms of cleanliness and services. The place is close to natural, ideal for honey moon or stay away from the city. The package deal is value for money including dinner and breakfast. The swimming pool is so nice . We enjoyed our stay.
Good experience. Staff friendly and patient. Free parking could have been better expanded to cover parking within all of Resorts World Sentosa

Everything was good at the hotel. The management acknowledged to my early check in and late check out request. Only feedback is the bathtub in room 0438 keeps leaking and my bathtub can never be full.

Pros: Rooms are really big and comfy, shuttle buses to other entertainments, the rooms are sanitized (feeling safe) Cons: Need to travel out to other entertainments, no toiletries for kids. no snacks for kids, some dust can be found on the bed headboard, bathroom tv not working, required to travel out for the free breakfast Overall: still happy with our stay with Equarius Hotel and will definitely come back again despite of the minor issues.
Friendly staffs and willing to assist whenever needed. Awesome stay and strongly recommended to friends.

Check-in was overall smooth although with some hiccup. Room was big and service was good. Have to walk quite a-bit from hotel lobby to the lift though. The fridge has a weird smell and we did not use at all. Buggy frequency ok but the staff over at hotel Michael side needs to ensure proper queuing of guests using the rides. Went during weekdays and most of the shops and restaurants were closed.

Wasn’t able to check in early, went in at usual check in time 3PM but was told the room was not ready yet. The check in area was very crowded, looks like early check in wasn’t possible. After one hour of waiting, we went back to ask and was told the room is still not ready. But by then most of the guests were cleared. Pretty unfair that we were held back for so long, we asked when would it be ready and the staff couldn’t answer us, said latest by 5PM. Usually check out time for most hotels is 12pm but this hotel was 11am. 4 hours to prepare rooms were not enough on a weekday? End up need 6 hours? On previous staycations there were times we were denied late checkout in order to prepare for the next guest’s room, where was this preparation? They told us 1PM was the latest checkout they could give, which was essentially giving us back the 2 hours they took from us. We couldn’t put our bags down and go explore sentosa in 2hours. Even if we could, they couldn’t tell us only after 1.5h when our room will be ready. Giving us back the time they took from us was not enough, it should have been a given since it was their error. When we asked if there was more that could be done for us like dining credits or upgrade or later checkout, they said no. That is really bad service when it’s my friend and mine’s special day to celebrate my graduation but instead my day of planned activities were thoroughly ruined. Giving us 2 hours more of hotel wouldn’t have remedied our compromised plans. After we checked into our room we called the guest service to ask again if something could be done and they said they would call us back. They in fact never called back. Furthermore, we asked for a knife to cut some fruit but were told there were no sharp items as part of their policy. Seriously? There was also no conditioner and laundry bags which I thought was a given. I used to bring those until 5 hotels I’ve been to provided them. This is a small matter but still we were somewhat inconvenienced. The room was great, but what horrified us was that there were dead flies found on the bathtub overnight. The tub was big and spacious which we enjoyed but finding flies on it the next day was gross. They also didn’t bother to cover the mattress. When we asked for more tea, they gave them to us in a trash bag. Overall very disappointing service, which we expected more since it’s a sentosa staycation. Undeniably the room was big and nice except for the lack of some stuff provided and the dead flies. Poor service and lack of preparation really ruined our staycation experience. We expected more since it’s sentosa and meant to be more ‘atas’. Also instructions to get here were not accurate, we spent an hour walking around trying to find the place until we were told you can’t even walk there and need to take another shuttle service that is not advertised or shown publicly. The directions given on the website are not good enough. What was very apparent was that the staff didn’t care about us. We are relieved our 2 hours were given back to us, but the coldness towards us when we asked for more were not appreciated (they initially wanted to give us 1 hour back only). We felt like we didn’t ask for much, we just wanted a gesture or token for the severe inconvenience and unhappiness they caused us. It’s a staycation meant for us to relax but we were kept stalled and idling when we had a whole day planned for us (I.e. go to the beach then have dinner - instead just have dinner cause no time to go to the beach else too late to have dinner, and then it rained the next day so can’t go to the beach) Felt like it was a waste of the SRV voucher, without the app deal to cover some of the costs, we would be way more infuriated. Still, $131 was a waste of money, I can definitely get better service and experiences from other 5 star hotels with the same money with SRV and app deals. Though the room is spacious and nice, our experience is screaming otherwise especially with the flies. Both my friend’s skin and mine broke out the next day, making us question the cleanliness of the place or the sheets since our room took that long to get ready. The shortage of staff probably was so that the rooms were not even thoroughly cleaned. Not sure if this is typical of Sentosa hotels but most likely not coming back here again. Seriously, I expect this kind of experience or service from a 2 star hotel, or even 3 star hotel staff service. The staff were not even apologetic. The safe distancing ambassadors and shuttle staff were even friendlier than the hotel staff

Had a hard time looking for directions to Equarius as no information was provided, even their signboards at RWS was not updated with 'Equarius'. Thankfully we managed to find St Michael's Hotel and took a buggy from there. Arrived at the hotel after a long wait for the buggy (buggy timing intervals can be improved). Sadly, there was no staff to greet nor direct us to the check in counter (disappointing for a 5 star hotel), we had to look around for staff only to see SDAs, which was very confusing as they seemed to be managing the check in queue instead of uniformed staff. Got a number from an SDA (not a hotel uniformed staff, confusing) and the queue was horrendously long. Thankfully I walked around the hotel while waiting and then noticed there was a self check in counter which had a short queue and managed to check in smoothly without having to wait in the queue. Would have appreciated if the SDAs since there was barely any other staff around, had the initiative to direct us to the self check in machine instead of just directing us to join the queue; this will not only improve your guests waiting time but also your hotel productivity (that's the point of your machine right?). Room was huge, clean and was overall great. But not so satisfied when the TV was not in working condition, the toilet bowl area had a strong sewage smell and one of the power point was not working. Disappointing in these aspects. Also pretty disappointed that it was our anniversary (had notify the hotel), but all we got was a card that was not signed off by any staff and a sad looking single red balloon, not impressive at all. Had higher expectations as I saw multiple reviews that other guests when celebrated their anniversary at Equarius received teddy bears, signed cards by staffs, complimentary room upgrade etc...All we got was a card and balloon. Other 5 stars hotel would at least fold towels into swan shapes and place it on the bed or put some petals around the room.. Not impressed for our special occasion. :( Would give this experience a 2.5/5, may not be back again as the experience didn't WOW me at all and the hotel isn't exactly located conveniently anyway. :(

Hotel room is fine and facilities good. But staff was not efficient due to miscommunication or overworked I suppose. Waited for about 2 hours to check in; staff said one of our rooms had no bathtub which was incorrect. There are bathtubs for our 2 rooms. Requested for adjoining rooms, got them but one door linking our rooms was faulty and could not be opened at all. We did not bother to report anyway. My children were locked out of their rooms after their swim on the 2nd day as they thought they had checked out which was ridiculous. They apologised and gave us an extra hour to check out though. On the whole, just felt that the service fell short of our expectations given that the hotel is reputed to be one of the best in RWS.
Big rooms, big tub, excellent service, peaceful part of sentosa, our room had a great view of the cable cars

Had booked a room with garden view, the scenery was awesome and beautiful. Room was spacious and clean, it was a great experience away from the city. Except had difficulties locating the hotel, it would be better if info of shuttle bus service is provided after the booking. Overall, it is a good experience^^

The bathrooms are great (no fighting during wash up time as there are two sinks) and the room size is a plus! Furnishings are plush, well maintained, and as each room has a balcony (mine overlooks the adventure cove waterpark), it truly feels like you are “overseas” for a while as compared to a staycation in town. Breakfast (need to take a shuttle to Hotel Michael) is decent if you need to fill your stomach but ok to skip too if you like to sleep in. Check in was a little slow and the need to check nice everytime you wish to go back to the room from the lobby is quite a hassle. The shuttle service from Monday 3.30pm onwards till Fri apparently is only provided via buggy rides (so you can still get a little wet when it rains). Only on weekends do they provide the 12 seater van for shuttle service.
The counter staff - Su Ying is extremely Attentive and kind. The hotel room is big and very cozy. Will definitely come back. Again!!
The ambience of the hotel is awesome. We had an enjoyable stay. The staff made us feel welcomed and were very friendly to interact with.

Took the Island Joy deluxe room package with breakfast with dolphin. Loved the huge room with great sea view and dream bathroom. Swimming at the private villa area was great. Staff are very friendly, esp Ariel who sent us back and forth to dolphin island with a great smile. Enjoyed all the free buggy rides out to RWS. The breakfast with dolphin is super worth, esp during covid period now, you get exclusive time with them. The whole stay was a memorable experience.
=- Clean and spacious room. - Thoughtful and helpful staff. - Nice view. Highly recommended. I would go back again

This hotel is great. We stay for 1 night and the room is spacious. We have a super king size bed and we are given sea view. Hotel staff is friendly. The only downside is we have to take a shuttle bus to Micheal hotel for breakfast.

The hotel room is spacious and there's a balcony with nice view. Great for family staycations. But only flaw is maybe due to covid, the breakfast is served at another hotel and it is a little far from the main attraction area. Luckily the hotel provide free rides to hotel Michael where we can get to dining and other facilities.
Booked a stay for my parents at the equarius and they enjoyed their stay very much! Thank you Traveloka for the epic sale 🥰
I was given a room on the 5th floor, which doesn’t look like the photo in your website. The balcony is all concrete, whereas the photo shows otherwise.

The service was great, however the room I was in had issues with hot water that was intermittently unavailable. There were buses running on weekends, but it seems that the shuttle service changed to buggy on weekdays. Some queueing and waiting is expected as each buggy could only accommodate 4 to 6 pax.  But the check in services was nice to accommodate as I had queried how would a consumer know as we rely on third party agents for full information when the booking was made.
Spacious room with high ceiling with cityview. Staff are friendly & helpful, definitely will stay at this hotel again.

Room is very huge, including toilet. Nice little balcony to hang out while watching sunset/sunrise. Very quiet and peaceful, good to recharge yourself. The pool area is huge. Enjoyed swimming. Only downside is that the breakfast is located in another hotel, although there’s shuttle service, a little hassle. It’s not ala carte buffet so you can actually skip the breakfast. And there are no room service. If they have, would be great. However, you can order from the restaurant around RWS so that’s pretty good
no where to find food other than out of hotel via shuttle to another hotel. minimumly should have a food outlet for takeway if claimed is too small. room was not cleaned, merely touch and go

This accommodation is perfect for birthday treat for your lovesome and very suitable for families with toddlers. My boys are 5, 4 and 1 year old. We booked the staycation there to celebrate my son's birthday and it went so well. We especially loved the room is super huge and it's comfortable to stay in with big families. The balcony allows the adult to have a separate space for short period of time while the children entertained themselves with the tv, or their personal phones on the comfort of the huge bed. My baby was enjoying himself crawling around the room that is full carpet which is a bonus for us. Places are clean and service is over the top, the response very quickly to attend to your needs. The pool is wonderful. We enjoy our time there and look forward to be back there again.
Great hotel. Gym is at Hotel Michael which was small and a little out dated. Excellent service by the staffs.

Big room and cozy but don't have any room services (Drink and snacks or foods) From direct hotel, you can order with qr code menu from other place with free delivery $30+ and this hotel isn't recommend for kids or baby. The swimming pool is L nice but have many mosquito and can't go near the villa. No kids zone no kids pool. For the gym you have to walk go to other hotel. Check in abit slow and have to book appointments for check in times.
Service was great and the room was big. Due to the pandemic situation, buggy ride (with scheduled timings) was offered to and from between Equarius Hotel and Michael Hotel.

As per hotel requirements, we reach to check in at 3pm but we only can to check in after 1 hour later. When you thought you going get your room, they told you that you can only have the room 1 hour later. It become 5pm then I am able to get the room. So I ask for late check out but only able to extend from 11am to 12noon. I checked in earlier than my friend, but she got her room first. No breakfast provided there. You need to take shuttle bus to RWS to get your breakfast fix. It is the season for cricket or some bugs. Keep flying around the balcony. It is very huge. Quite a few until I don’t even dare to see the view.

Pros: Spacious room Nice pool Cons - base on expectation of a 5 stars hotel: 1) Check in is such a hassle; reach around 2pm and was told to wait in a waiting area with a waiting number and when your number is called, you need to wait again near the check in counter, once its your turn for check in, they register you and tell me my room is not ready and I need to check later with the concierge at 3pm to see if my room is ready. Check with concierge at 3.05pm and was told its not ready and told me to wait for another 15mins. When I go back 15mins later, I was again told it is not ready and say to wait 5mins, when I go back 5mins later I was told to queue up for my turn, 20mins in the queue did I finally get my room. 2) Weird smell on the bed sheets. Not sure what detergent the hotel use but the smell is not pleasant. 3) There is a drainage smell in the bathroom. the bathroom is very big with a bathtub and a separate shower area, the stench come from there which after some investigation, I conclude the shower area might not have been use for awhile (who will use that if there is a bathtub available), I suspect the smell come up from the shower area drainage hole. 4) Tattered hand towel, I am surprised a 5stars hotel never screen through the towel they serve. 5) Dusty at some area in the room. Some area of the rooms are not clean up properly, the study table below the table is dusty. 5) Staff nor evenly distributed to work around. There are 4-5 staff around check in area and the secondary waiting area but only 3-4 check in counters are open. There are another 2 staff to check your ID at a narrow walkway towards hotel lift, do they need 2 person there since there is only 1 laptop doing the checking? How many checking do we need, Too many checks for my leisure stay not a relaxing staycation. Overall not worth the price, I pay almost $600 for 3d2n. I have been to other hotels during this period and the check in is a breeze and I was even given early check in from hotels busier than Equarius and I also saw quite a few hotel guest complaining the same thing.
The room was spacious and clean! Very good service overall. Highly recommended.

The room and view from the room is fantastic! However, the check in process is too long. Reached around 2.30pm and check in waiting time took almost an hr and after that room wasn't ready till 5pm. That was quite a letdown and time wasted. The location is a distance from the main Resort World area but there is free shuttle to bring us over. Only thing is the waiting time sometimes. The pool is not within the main hotel area and had to walk out of the hotel and to the nearby beach villas. Slight inconvenience but still acceptable. Was a great staycation overall and a place I would return to.

the room is great, love how spacious it is. aside from that, entire experience there was rather unpleasant. I booked 3 rooms for my family of 7. requested for connecting room as we had a baby and it would be more convenient. initially the staff declined our request because my brother in law ic is of different residential address. had to make a fuss before they gave us the connecting room. and I do not understand the 5 pax per room rule? I thought restrictions had been eased and social gathering of 8 person is allowed? anyway, they also require every single person's IC for registration which is understandable however each time we exit and go back to our hotel room, we need to present our IC again. even baby needs to have their birth cert presented. staff were extremely inflexible/unaccommodating. do not recommend visiting this hotel especially if you have a big family.

Room was spacious & big, with balcony & large bathroom, good views. Area was peaceful & quiet as well. Had to book 1 hour slots for use of swimming pool but wasn't crowded. Buggy shuttle between hotel & main RWS area was quite frequent, around 5-10 min wait.

Room lights were not working. Took the technician 20mins to ge to our room to rectify the issue. While room was spacious, it was old and worn out. Needs an uplift to make it value for money. Inadequate drinking water provided. Breakfast was terrible, with extremely limited choice. Understand its covid, but setting check in at 3pm and check out at 11am is extreme. Was not worth the money paid for the staycation.
room is great! check in wait is long though
I would highly recommend. Staying near to the nature.
Manage to find time to stand still.

My family loved this hotel so much. Its so quiet and peaceful. The resort feels so far away from Singapore, I imagined I was on some Island Resort in another country. The pool has big mosquitoes though but it’s not surprising due to the many trees on the island. The room and toilet is big and spacious. Nice space for kids.
we had an amazing stay the room was huge, the space was great and will stay here again!

It’s my 3rd times stay cation there, will always top class. But this round my room was not ready. I was there at 3pm as stated to check in at 3pm. But need to wait till like 5pm for my room to be ready. But the hotel extended my check out timing. Thank you so much. Will always come back.

Cons: 1) check in took more than an hr and staff was unapologetic. 2) it’s silly to need to bring Ic to the swimming pool when there are no lockers next to the pool side. 3) there are sharp pebbles when entering the pool 4) breakfast is not at e hotel but at Hotel Micheal. There is shuttle bus to hotel Michael. Breakfast food is of mediocre standard Pros: 1) nice and big swimming pool 2) shuttle bus drivers are the most friendly among all e Equarius staff

The hotel is really good stay for family gateway, the deluxe room is huge, the toilet and bathtub was amazingly huge too! I like how the toilet and shower is separated. In terms of distance wise, you would need to take a buggy from outside Hotel Michael to get to the hotel. The staff are really helpful and friendly! Despite the waiting time for check in took awhile, they make sure we are at a comfortable place waiting, no overcrowding during check in.

The staff were awesome honestly. always so friendly and professional. they have made the experience really nice for us if not for the other stuff: I just didn't expect some of the things such as parking was free but for only 1 exit. We booked 3 rooms, 1 for ourselves and 2 for our parents and in laws (they were 70-80yrs old). we drove 2 cars and cos the location was quite a distance to the beach, and our parents couldn't walk a lot, we drove in and out of the car park. all within Sentosa, jus that once you drive out of rws carpark, you have to pay for parking. the lady was nice enough to give us 1 extra ticket. but cos we go in and out a few times, we still had to pay parking. parking in rws wasn't cheap. the other thing was that every time you step out of the room to go to reception or the pool, you have to dig out for your IC when you come back in-for every single person. I understand that it's a requirement. but there's gotta be a way to make it more efficient. I had 6 bags of food in my hands when I'm alone, I had to struggle to take my IC out. if we forgot something in the car not even 5mins after coming into the room entrance, we still had to show our IC. I went for a staycay in other hotels but it wasn't like this. this was to the extent of annoying. there's gotta be a way to fix check this IC only at the entrance of hotel and that's it. breakfast - I didn't know the breakfast was not within Aquarius. we had to take a shuttle bus to go for breakfast. not far but again, if you have elderly with u, it's not very convenient. getting a swimming slot was also quite impossible. on the day of check no slots. our kids were upset cos they really wanted to swim. but you know what.. we decided to try our luck 1.5 hour before we checked out and went ahead for walk-in. the pool was not not crowded. maybe only 10 people in there. we managed to squeeze in only a 30min swim, better than nothing. the pool was beautiful and we could have spent more time there if it wasn't for the booking being full. sure, there's probably some inconsiderate people who booked but did not turn up. perhaps a waiting list would be great. another hotel we stayed in, called us when those who booked did not turn up.

All aspects of this stay was awesome. Despite being in a COVID situation, they provided safety checks without compromising service standards. So unlike MBS stay I had last week which was horrendous as we were treated like criminals. Well done Equarius. I’ll definitely come again!
The room was spacious and we got a very clear view of the cable cars. Will definitely visit again.

- Breakfast was not in the hotel itself. Need to travel to Hotel Michael via shuttle service. Very inconvenient as the time is until 1030am only. This information is not provided in the website/coupon. - Parking is given per night one only unlike other hotels I have stayed before. Hence, upon check in, you cannot travel out unless you don't mind paying the carpark fee tt can be expensive. - No In room dining or restaurant in the hotel itself. The food to order is from Malaysian street which is limited & not everything is halal. Ended up buying via Foodpanda. - Check out time is strictly 11am. No extension given. - Cleaniness is 3/5. The room is still smelly and balcony was dirty. Eg. have brid shit and cigg ashes around. - Do not expect any complimentary snacks/to buy snacks off the bar. There is nothing except 2 small carton of water. Best is to bring your own food/snacks! Positive Feedback: Wellplanned on the check-in as it was smooth. Good service by the Hotel Staff.

Loved the room. Do note the check out time is 11, not 12. Bathroom was so spacious and balcony was cute. Room was clean. Especially loved the spacious bathroom that had both a shower door and toilet door + a seat to do makeup. 2 sinks too. And a bathtub. Ughhh we loved it. The bride to be is v particular about cleanliness and this passed her test and we had a rly nice time here and it was v hard to leave.

Had the best staycation ever! Service of the staffs made us feel very welcome. The room was very big, nice and comfortable! Can hear the sound of nature. Very relaxing. We wanted to take some photos in the room hence we requested for a simple decoration. We shared the photos of the room on our social media and our friends were asking about it. Thank you for taking such good care of a preggie!

I had an amazing experience here. A wonderful escape from reality. Customer service, hotel location and cleanliness were great! The shuttle service to the hotel comes every few mins which is super convenient. The rooms had a beautiful view of the trees and the pillows were very comfortable unlike at other hotels. I had an amazing time at the pool too. This was my 2nd time here and it definitely wouldn't be my last.

Awesome staff, huge room & bathroom! Air-condition was quiet and cold. Loving the shuttle bus for our convenience as the hotel was a tad far away from the eateries. Overall would love to come back and stay. Only downside is that there’s no room service, had to order food from elsewhere.

Awesome service by hotel staff, Mr Simran, he was very friendly & the check-in was very fast and efficient. He showed genuine & personal care to ensure we have an enjoyable stay at Equarius Hotel. Great job, Mr Simran!

I would like to thank Gregory for fantastic service given, and accommodating our request with the fantastic room view, and the size of the room is just amazing. It was enjoyable and relaxing for me and my family. It has a very nice pool. And yes we will come back. Thank you again.
The deluxe room was very spacious including the restroom and balcony. Love the rain shower and bathtub. Room and bedsheets were clean. Would definitely come back for a staycation.

Great stay with awesome view at the hotel~ Love the amenities and the toilet especially, it’s super huge and there’s Tv! Bed is very comfortable too and clean overall. The breakfast is very scrumptious too

Check in slot was secured earlier but ended up we had to wait almost an addition one and a half hour before checking in. Staff were virtually clueless and kept on insisting room was not ready. On the way to the room, 2 of the hotel barged in the lift, preventing us from exiting the lift. One of the staff was Darren. Rooms were fairly decent for the price. The last thing was we had to travel to another hotel for breakfast, which was troublesome and ridiculous.
Spacious room and toilet! Awesome view from the balcony and they offer a nice pool too!

The rooms are very very spacious, especially by Singapore standard! We got the connecting rooms with King beds on the 4th floor and it comfortably fits 4 adults and 3 kids with plenty of room to spare. The beds are super comfy, the bath amenities are lovely, the shower works perfectly, everything was clean, definitely, nothing to complain about! I especially love how the hotel did not provide drinking water in plastic bottles. They provided refillable water jugs instead, which we can easily fill with ice/cold water in the nearby ice/water machine at the end of the hall. Getting around was really easy with the free and frequent shuttle buses that took us to nearby hotels and the forum - where we can find plenty of dining and shopping options (including casinos and entrance to the Universal Studio Singapore) The hotel also provided us with complimentary monorail tickets valid for 3 days - so we can easily go back and forth to vivo city mall to do more shopping and find more dining options.

This Hotel Located in the corner of resort world sentosa. The breakfast is good. and we can get shuttle bus to go to Universal Studio and any other attractions. I would like to stay in this hotel when I go to sentosa island.
Really nice hotel. Big room and good service. Need improvement about breakfast.
Great place, great service. I will go back for sure
Really awesome room! Very comfortable. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast had many varieties and tasty.Worth the price!
Receptionist breakfast is not good.Terrible Attitude !
The hotel room and facilities are excellent. But some of the hotel staff were a bit rude for a 5 star hotel. And I can tell they were bias to certain guest. I hope they can do better.
Spacious room, clean, comfortable. Location not too far from the entertainment and shopping area, walkable distance. Very warm welcome and services by the staffs.
Great hotel, large room, super clean, great service. Everything is perfect.

It was a very great experience and wonderful holiday for me and my family. We traveled with 3 kids and the kids loved the room. Very safe, comfortable, and child friendly. They have shuttle bus. Highly recommended for tourists who travel with kids.
the best hotel in sentosa....room, staff, service was perfect.
Room was great. Shuttle service was a big plus.
We have a great time in Equarius Hotel.
great hotel and great services
Clean, comfort, but check in very late...
clean, comfort room and good service
Best..probably the best in RWS area
My stay at Equarius was so great...i got a luxurious room because they upgraded for me... and the breakfast also good... most of all I had very good experience soon i'll go back there...
Quiet tranquil best service and not far from Universal
Overall this hotel is comfortable for who want to get the simple holiday, near from us, waterpark is on backside of the hotel very comfy
Great hotel for family and pleasure.
Very strategic hotel. Good breakfast and clean room! Luv it!
Very nice & comfort hotel in sentosa
Very good, big room, nice bathroom, clean
The rooms are spacious. Bathrooms are very spacious. The bathtub is great. Around the hotel is very beautiful. All is ok.
Good hotel, big room, good hotel service, only restaurant service is lacking.
Very satisfied to stay at the hotel equarius, our january 2018 will be back again.
Her nice hotel is cozy and friendly, clean and there is her balcony.
Satisfactory, I stay with my husband and my ank (7months) for booking a deluxe hotel but replaced with deluxe suite, the service is very satisfactory check in.

We stayed 2 nights 29-31 March 2017 .. The first impression of his hotel comfortable and nice, clean. The receptionist was also friendly. Minji is also beautiful and good. We are very happy to stay at Equarius .. Our 2 days playing in the sea aquarium and universal. There is a mini van shuttle so there was no trouble and enjoy ...
Clean, large room, my son loved being near USS. Next year will return to Equarius again
Rooms are large, clean and tidy. My son especially very happy to stay there
The rooms are spacious and suitable for a family holiday.
The hotel rooms are spacious and elegant especially when coupled Free Wifi, perfect dech
The rooms are spacious and nice and clean, there is a sofa able to sleep, only if you want something to eat hard, had to go to the hotel area or Vivo City Michael just had to take a train again
Spacious rooms, Good View, the overall satisfactory.
That was awesome and we really enjoyed it
Big room Nice view Good food Friendly staff
Hotel and its very good service
They are spacious, clean and his hotel staff also helpfull our family plans to stay here again kl k singapore holidays
Rooms are large and clean, friendly staff. The location is somewhat apart from other hotels in the complex collection of Resorts World Sentosa.
